faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about our pricing

trial.question: How does the 14-day free trial work?
trial.answer: You get full access to all Pro features for 14 days. No credit card required. After the trial, you can choose to continue with Pro or downgrade to our Free plan.

cancel.question: Can I cancel my subscription anytime?
cancel.answer: Yes, you can cancel your subscription at any time. Your access will continue until the end of your current billing period.

payment.question: What payment methods do you accept?
payment.answer: We accept all major credit cards (Visa, Mastercard, Amex), PayPal, and in select regions, local payment methods like Razorpay (India), Paystack (Africa), and MercadoPago (Latin America).

discount.question: Do you offer discounts for annual billing?
discount.answer: Yes! Annual billing comes with a 20% discount compared to monthly billing. Contact our sales team for enterprise pricing.

limits.question: What happens when I exceed my free plan limits?
limits.answer: You'll receive a notification when you're approaching your limits. You can upgrade to Pro at any time to continue using the platform without interruption.

switch.question: Can I switch between plans?
switch.answer: Yes, you can upgrade or downgrade your plan at any time. When upgrading, you'll have immediate access to new features. When downgrading, changes take effect at the next billing cycle.

schedule.title: Call Scheduling
schedule.description: Control when calls are made to ensure you reach contacts at appropriate times
schedule.tooltip: Restrict calls to specific time windows and days. Ensures compliance with local regulations and improves contact rates by reaching people at appropriate times. Calls outside the time window will be queued automatically.
schedule.startTimeTooltip: The earliest time calls can be made each day in the selected timezone. Example: 09:00 means calls start at 9 AM.
schedule.endTimeTooltip: The latest time calls can be made each day in the selected timezone. Example: 17:00 means calls stop at 5 PM.
schedule.daysTooltip: Select which days of the week calls can be made. For business campaigns, select Monday-Friday. For urgent campaigns, you can include weekends.
schedule.timezoneTooltip: The timezone for your calling hours. All scheduled times are interpreted in this timezone. Choose the timezone where most of your contacts are located.

create.stabilityTooltip: Controls voice consistency. Higher values = more stable and consistent voice. Lower values = more expressive and emotional.
create.similarityBoostTooltip: Enhances voice similarity to original. Higher values = closer to original voice but may reduce clarity.
create.speechSpeedTooltip: Controls how fast the agent speaks. Range: 0.7x (slower) to 1.2x (faster). Default is 1.0 (normal speed).
create.systemToolsTooltip: Enable advanced system tools to enhance agent capabilities. These tools are automatically integrated into the conversation flow when enabled.

create.languageDetectionDescriptionFull: Automatically detect and respond in caller's language (99 languages)
create.llmModelTooltip: The AI brain powering your agent's conversations. Different models offer varying levels of performance and cost. This determines how the agent processes and responds during calls.
create.chooseModelFlow: Choose the AI model for your Flow agent. This determines how the agent interprets and responds during conversations.
create.chooseModel: Choose the AI model for your agent. Different models offer varying levels of performance and capabilities.
create.temperatureTooltip: Controls the creativity of responses. Lower values (0.0) make responses more deterministic and consistent. Higher values (1.0) make responses more creative and varied.
create.temperatureTooltipFull: Temperature is a parameter that controls the creativity or randomness of the responses generated by the LLM. Lower values (0.0) make responses more deterministic and consistent. Higher values (1.0) make responses more creative and varied.
create.systemPromptTooltip: Instructions for how the agent should behave. This provides context and guidelines for the AI during the conversation. The workflow logic takes priority, but this shapes the agent's tone and approach.
create.systemPromptTooltipFull: The core instructions that define your agent's behavior, role, and expertise. Use templates below for best practices on natural conversations, polite tone, and professional interactions.
create.systemPromptPlaceholderFlow: You are a professional phone agent conducting a structured conversation. Follow the workflow exactly as defined. Be polite, clear, and concise in your responses.
create.systemPromptHint: Define the agent's personality and guidelines. The workflow controls what the agent says, but this shapes how it says it.
create.firstMessageTooltip: The opening statement when the call connects. This is what the agent says first before following the workflow. Use {{contact_name}} for personalization.
create.firstMessageTooltipFull: The opening statement when the call connects. Use {{contact_name}} for personalization. Keep it warm, natural, and conversational - avoid sounding robotic or overly formal.
create.firstMessagePlaceholderFlow: Hello! I'm calling to assist you today.
create.firstMessagePlaceholder: Hi {{contact_name}}, this is Alex from Acme Company. How are you doing today?

create.firstMessageBestPractices: Best practices: Start warm and natural. Good: "Hi {{contact_name}}, this is Sarah from ABC Corp, how's your day going?" Avoid: "This is an automated call for {{contact_name}}."

templates.customerSupportContent:
You are a warm and professional customer support agent for our company. Your goal is to help customers with their questions in a friendly, natural way.

CONVERSATION STYLE:
- Always be polite, patient, and respectful
- Use a warm, conversational tone throughout the entire call
- Listen actively and acknowledge what customers say
- Never sound rushed or robotic

GREETING:
- Start with a friendly greeting using their name naturally (if provided)
- Introduce yourself and your purpose clearly
- Give them a moment to respond before continuing

HANDLING INFORMATION:
- Ask for information politely: "May I have your name?" or "Could you share your email?"
- Never demand information abruptly
- Thank them when they provide information
- Confirm what you heard: "Great, thanks [Name]!"

TONE CONSISTENCY:
- Maintain the same warm, helpful tone from start to finish
- Avoid sudden tone changes
- Show genuine interest in helping

Remember: Keep it natural, friendly, and professional throughout.
templates.salesLeadQualificationContent:
You are a friendly sales agent helping potential customers learn about our products/services. Your approach is consultative, not pushy.

CONVERSATION STYLE:
- Be enthusiastic but never aggressive
- Focus on understanding their needs first
- Build rapport naturally before discussing products
- Maintain a warm, helpful tone throughout

GREETING & NAME HANDLING:
- Greet warmly and naturally: "Hi, this is [Your Name] from [Company]"
- If you know their name, use it warmly: "Hi [Name], how are you today?"
- If asking for their name: "I'd love to know who I'm speaking with - may I ask your name?"
- Always thank them: "Thanks [Name], great to speak with you!"

DISCOVERY:
- Ask open-ended questions about their needs
- Listen more than you talk
- Show genuine interest in helping solve their problems

TONE:
- Stay positive and helpful throughout
- Never sound scripted or robotic
- Keep the energy conversational, not salesy

Goal: Build trust and help them find the right solution.
templates.appointmentSchedulingContent:
You are a professional appointment scheduler helping people book consultations or meetings with our team.

CONVERSATION STYLE:
- Be efficient but friendly
- Make the process easy and stress-free
- Stay patient and accommodating

GREETING:
- Start warmly: "Hi, I'm calling from [Company] to help you schedule an appointment"
- Use their name naturally if provided
- Give them context right away

INFORMATION GATHERING:
- Ask questions politely, one at a time
- Explain why you need each piece of information
- Confirm details back to them
- Be flexible with their schedule

TONE:
- Professional yet personable throughout
- Patient and understanding
- Never rush them
- Thank them frequently for their time and information

Remember: Make scheduling easy and pleasant!
templates.followUpFeedbackContent:
You are a courteous follow-up agent checking in with customers about their recent experience or interest.

CONVERSATION STYLE:
- Be respectful of their time
- Sound genuinely interested in their feedback
- Stay positive and non-intrusive

GREETING:
- Friendly introduction: "Hi [Name], this is [Your Name] from [Company]"
- State your purpose clearly: "I'm following up on..."
- Ask if it's a good time to talk

GATHERING FEEDBACK:
- Ask open questions: "How was your experience?"
- Listen actively and acknowledge their responses
- Thank them for their feedback
- Address any concerns with empathy

TONE:
- Appreciative and warm
- Never sound like you're reading a script
- Maintain genuine interest
- Be brief but thorough

Goal: Make them feel valued and heard.

planSettings.title: Plan Settings
planSettings.defaultLlmTooltip: The default AI model (e.g., GPT-4o Mini) assigned to agents created by Free plan users. Pro users can choose any available model.
planSettings.bonusCreditsTooltip: Number of free credits automatically added to a user's account when they subscribe to the Pro plan. This is a one-time bonus.
planSettings.bonusCreditsHint: Credits given when subscribing to Pro plan

pricing.title: Pricing Settings
pricing.creditPriceTooltip: Multiplier for calculating call costs. Call duration is rounded UP to the nearest minute, then multiplied by this value. Example: 64 seconds = 2 minutes × this rate. This is used for internal cost calculations only.
pricing.phoneMonthlyTooltip: Number of credits charged per month for renting a phone number. Users pay this amount when purchasing and then monthly thereafter. Default is 50 credits.
pricing.phoneMonthlyHint: Credits charged for phone number rental (monthly)
pricing.minPurchaseTooltip: The minimum number of credits users must purchase at once. This helps ensure transaction fees don't eat into small purchases.
pricing.llmMarginTooltip: DISPLAY ONLY: Shows estimated AI processing costs on agent creation screen for transparency. Your actual profit margin comes from credit package pricing strategy (e.g., selling 100 credits for $50 vs. your costs).
pricing.llmMarginHint: Profit margin percentage added to LLM costs shown to users

resources.title: System Resources
resources.poolSizeTooltip: Number of shared phone numbers maintained for Free plan users. These numbers are shared among all free users to reduce infrastructure costs while allowing them to test the platform.
resources.poolSizeHint: Number of phone numbers to keep in pool for free users

tools.title: System Tools
tools.syncAllCallsDesc: Fetch and sync call data from both ElevenLabs and Twilio. Gets transcripts, recordings, phone numbers, and duration from both sources to provide complete call information.
tools.syncIncomingWebhooksDesc: Configure ElevenLabs webhooks for all incoming connections to enable automatic call logging
tools.webhooksConfigured: Successfully configured {{success}} of {{total}} incoming agent webhooks.

autoRestart.title: Auto Restart System
autoRestart.description: Configure automatic restart when resource limits are exceeded
autoRestart.enableToggleDesc: Automatically restart when resource thresholds are exceeded
autoRestart.ramLimitTooltip: Restart when system RAM usage exceeds this percentage (50-95%)
autoRestart.cpuLimitTooltip: Restart when CPU usage exceeds this percentage (20-95%)
autoRestart.activeMessage: Auto-restart is active. The system will gracefully restart when RAM or CPU limits are exceeded for 3 consecutive checks (90 seconds).
autoRestart.ramMonitoringDesc: Uses real system memory readings via Node.js APIs. Accurately measures total and free memory on the server. Works reliably across all environments.
autoRestart.cpuMonitoringDesc: Combines process CPU time with system load average for more accurate readings. Shows CPU cores and 1-minute load average. In development/sandboxed environments, readings may vary.
autoRestart.restartBehaviorDesc: Triggers graceful shutdown after 3 consecutive threshold breaches (90 seconds). Requires a process manager (PM2, systemd) to restart the application. In development environments, the app may just exit without restarting.
autoRestart.productionNote: For best results, deploy with PM2 or a similar process manager that automatically restarts the application after shutdown.

creditPackages.title: Credit Packages
creditPackages.description: Manage credit packages available for purchase
creditPackages.createDescription: Create a new credit package for users to purchase
creditPackages.packageNameTooltip: A descriptive name for this credit package that users will see when purchasing. Examples: 'Starter Pack', 'Enterprise Bundle', 'Pay-As-You-Go'.
creditPackages.packageDescTooltip: Additional details about this package that help users choose the right option. Example: 'Perfect for small campaigns' or 'Best value for high-volume calling'.
creditPackages.creditsTooltip: Number of calling credits included in this package. Each minute of calling costs 1 credit (rounded up). Example: 100 credits = 100 minutes of calling time.
creditPackages.priceTooltip: The sale price users pay for this package in USD. Your profit margin is the difference between this price and your actual costs. The 'Price per credit' is calculated automatically.

payments.gatewayWarningDesc: Switching payment gateways will affect how new subscriptions are processed. Existing subscriptions on the previous gateway will continue to work until they expire or are manually migrated.
payments.paypalClientIdHint: Your PayPal Client ID from the Developer Dashboard
